com.ikalagaming.plugins.events

Class PluginCommandSent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ikalagaming.event.Event
      • com.ikalagaming.plugins.events.PluginCommandSent

  • public class PluginCommandSent
extends Event
    A command was sent.
    Author:
    Ches Burks

      Returns the command transmitted.

      Returns the type of the plugin that sent the command.

    • Constructor Detail

      • PluginCommandSent

        public PluginCommandSent(java.lang.String to,
                         java.lang.String command,
                         java.lang.String from)
        Creates a new PluginCommandSent with the supplied parameters. There is no guarantee that only the intended plugin will receive the message.
        Parameters:
        to - the Plugin type that owns the command
        command - the command
        from - the Plugin type that sent the command

      • PluginCommandSent

        public PluginCommandSent(java.lang.String to,
                         java.lang.String command,
                         java.lang.String[] args,
                         java.lang.String from)
        Creates a new PluginCommandSent with the supplied parameters. There is no guarantee that only the intended plugin will receive the message (yet?). If the arguments list is null, it will be created from the command, if the command has multiple parts.
        Parameters:
        to - the Plugin type that owns the command
        command - the command
        args - arguments for the command
        from - the plugin type that sent the command

    • Method Detail

        Return the list of arguments, if there are any.

        Returns the command transmitted.
        Returns:

      • getFrom

        public java.lang.String getFrom()
        Returns the type of the plugin that sent the command.
        Returns:
        the name of the sending plugin

      • getTo

        public java.lang.String getTo()
        Returns the name of the plugin that the command was registered to.
        Returns:
        the name of the receiving plugin

      • hasArgs

        public boolean hasArgs()
        Returns true if arguments exist, or false if the arguments list is null or empty.
        Returns:
        true if there are arguments
